metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0775 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in the ImagingFliDecode function in libImaging/FliDecode.c in Pillow before 3.1.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted FLI file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0775` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-imaging - 3.1.2-1
python-pil - 3.1.2-1
python-pil.imagetk - 3.1.2-1
python3-pil - 3.1.2-1
python3-pil.imagetk - 3.1.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pillow package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.1.2-1').
